column2: IDAHO DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Idaho
column6: ID

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
column4: excessive driving
column6: defensive driving
column8: road rage

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: Stop before turning right
column6: Lane closed for traffic
column8: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 3. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column4: remove the sign and move forward.
column6: make a U-turn.
column8: look for a detour or another route.
column10: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: “Y” intersection ahead
column6: A four-way intersection is ahead
column8: A road joins from the right

column2: 5. If a vehicle is approaching with high beams, drivers should look __________ until the vehicle passes.
column4: at the center of the road
column6: to the right of the road
column8: straight ahead
column10: to the left of the road

column2: 6. Parking is not allowed:
column4: on the road side of a parked vehicle.
column6: in a crosswalk.
column8: in a tunnel.

column2: 7. You are approaching an intersection with a yellow flashing light. You should:
column4: proceed with caution through the intersection.
column6: stop and wait for the light to change.
column8: speed up to beat the red light.
column10: prepare to stop; the light is about to turn red.

column2: 8. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.
column6: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
column8: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 9. When you are in a line of traffic that is crossing a railroad track that has no signals or gates:
column4: you may pass slower drivers crossing the track.
column6: before you start to cross, you need to make sure there is space to get all the way across the tracks without stopping.
column8: you have the right of way and do not need to check for trains.

column2: 10. You must yield to other drivers:
column4: when they are coming out of an alley or driveway.
column6: only when a yield sign is present.
column8: when entering a street from an alley.

column2: 11. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
column4: waterplaning.
column6: pavement-planing.
column8: hydroplaning.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column4: Slippery when wet
column6: No U-Turn
column8: Winding road ahead

column2: 13. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column4: a train sign.
column6: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.
column8: a yield sign.

column2: 14. A flashing yellow light:
column4: warns drivers to proceed with caution.
column6: is used at dangerous intersections.
column8: can be found before reaching a sharp curve.

column2: 15. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who have overslept.
column6: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.
column8: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.

column2: 16. What are some telltale signs of a drunk driver?
column4: Driving slower than the normal flow of traffic.
column6: Sudden stops.
column8: Weaving between lanes.

column2: 17. A steady yellow light means that a ______ light will soon appear.
column4: steady green
column6: steady red
column8: flashing green

column2: 18. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column6: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column8: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.
column10: make alcohol the focus of the event.

column2: 19. When driving in icy or snowy conditions, to avoid crashes drivers should:
column4: add extra weight to the vehicle to improve traction.
column6: engage 4 wheel drive on the vehicle.
column8: get off the highway as quickly as possible.
column10: reduce speed and increase following distance.

column2: 20. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: wear approved helmets.
column6: signal turns, lane changes and stops.
column8: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.

column2: 21. In Idaho, bicyclists:
column4: All of the above.
column6: do not need to come to a complete stop at stop signs.
column8: must yield the right-of-way to vehicles in or already at the intersection.
column10: do not need to come to a complete stop when turning right on a red light.

column2: 22. If you suddenly have no control of the steering wheel, you should:
column4: turn on your emergency flashers and pull off the road.
column6: ease your foot off the gas pedal. Turn on your emergency flashers and allow your vehicle to come to a slow stop.
column8: pump your brake pedal to build pressure.
column10: react as you would with a blowout.

column2: 23. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column6: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column8: Only right turns are allowed.

column2: 24. If the traffic lights are out of service when you approach an intersection, you:
column4: must slow down and yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column6: must continue according to the rules of right-of-way.
column8: must proceed with caution.
column10: must come to a stop as you would for a stop sign.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down, stop if necessary and yield the right-of-way
column6: Merging traffic
column8: You must come to a complete stop

column2: 26. Alcohol causes:
column4: loss of concentration.
column6: poor judgment.
column8: reduced perception.

column2: 27. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column4: Stop sign
column6: Flashing red light
column8: Police officer

column2: 28. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.
column6: only if you have an emergency.
column8: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.
column10: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.

column2: 29. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.
column8: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.

column2: 30. If your turn signals fail, you should use _____ to indicate your intention to turn.
column4: your horn
column6: your high beams
column8: your emergency flashers

column2: 31. ABS is the acronym for:
column4: Anti-Braking System
column6: Anti-Locking Brake System
column8: Average-Beam System

column2: 32. Before turning, you should:
column4: increase your speed.
column6: sound your horn to alert the other drivers.
column8: give the proper turn signal.

column2: 33. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column4: Look to the left and right for other traffic.
column6: Merge left.
column8: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.

column2: 34. When meeting a car with blinding headlights, you should:
column4: use your emergency flashers to warn the other driver.
column6: dim your lights, then speed up and pass quickly.
column8: look toward the left side of the road.
column10: look toward the right side of the road.

column2: 35. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
column6: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.
column8: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column10: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.

column2: 36. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column4: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.
column6: Mirrors are useless.
column8: You should look over your shoulder instead.

column2: 37. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: stay in their lane.
column6: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column8: turn off the ignition.
column10: prepare to leave the lane safely.

column2: 38. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column6: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.
column8: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column10: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.

column2: 39. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.
column6: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column8: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.

column2: 40. This road sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop and yield right-of-way
column6: Always come to a complete stop
column8: Slow down and yield to traffic on main road when merging
